PARAGRAPH.STRING: ([Punjabi: ਚਨਾਬ], [IAST: canāb], [Urdu: چناب], [Hindi: चनाब] literally 'Moon(Chen) River(ab)') is formed by the confluence of the Chandra and Bhaga rivers at Tandi located in the upper Himalayas, in the Lahaul District of Himachal Pradesh, India. In
is also known as the Chandrabhaga.
flows through the Jammu region of Jammu and Kashmir into the plains of the Punjab, forming the boundary between the Rechna and Jech interfluves (Doabs in Persian).
is joined by the Jhelum River at Trimmu, and then by the Ravi River.
then merges with the Sutlej River near Uch Sharif to form the Panjnad ('Five Rivers'), which joins the Indus at Mithankot. The total length of
is approximately 960 kilometres. The waters of
are allocated to Pakistan under the terms of the Indus Waters Treaty.

was known to Indians in Vedic period as Ashkini or Iskmati and as Acesines to the Ancient Greeks. In 325 BC, Alexander the Great allegedly founded the town of Alexandria on Indus (present day Uch Sharif or Mithankot or Chacharan) at the confluence of the Indus and the combined stream of Punjab rivers (currently known as the Panjnad River).
has the same place in the consciousness of the people of the Punjab, as, say the Rhine holds for the Germans, or the Danube for the Austrians and the Hungarians.
plays a prominent part in the tale of Heer Ranjha, the Punjabi national epic.
